cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi W of Port Charlotte, FL
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA-MS coast).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana–Mississippi border (Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: MS/AL border to AL/FL border – Tropical Storm Watch: Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS; Tropical Storm Warning: East of Ocean Springs MS to Indian Pass FL; Storm Surge Warning: Port Fourchon LA to MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwest and west-central Florida (outer rain bands), entire north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer-band gusts 30–40 mph possible; sustained gale-force winds unlikely (≤5% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along west-central Florida coast including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–3 inches, isolated 4–6 inches, could cause localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches and small-craft operations.
